Package com.game.Tile

Class MysteriousSmokeTile

java.lang.Object
com.game.Utilities.Position
com.game.Tile.Tile
com.game.Tile.MysteriousSmokeTile
public class MysteriousSmokeTile extends Tile
Represents a tile that can affect the player's speed and has visibility toggles.

Extends the Tile class to introduce a mysterious smoke tile that, when activated or stepped on, can slow down the player for a certain period. The visibility of the tile can also be toggled to add an element of surprise and strategy. This tile enhances gameplay by introducing environmental hazards and challenges.

  • Constructor Details

    • MysteriousSmokeTile

      public MysteriousSmokeTile()
      Constructs a MysteriousSmokeTile with default properties.

      Initializes the tile to be steppable, not an end-level tile, and marks it as a mysterious smoke tile. Default properties can be modified as needed for specific gameplay scenarios.

  • Method Details

    • getSpeedModifier

      public int getSpeedModifier()
      Retrieves the speed modifier associated with stepping on this tile.

      This method allows access to the amount by which the player's speed will be reduced upon interacting with the mysterious smoke, affecting their ability to navigate the game.

      Returns:
      The amount of speed reduction.

    • engageSmoke

      public static void engageSmoke(Hero hero, MainGamePanel gp)
      Engages the smoke effect, making the tile visible.

      This method is intended to toggle the visibility of the mysterious smoke effect on, revealing the tile to the player. It can be called based on specific game events or conditions.

    • hideSmoke

      public void hideSmoke()
      Hides the smoke effect, making the tile invisible.

      This method toggles the visibility of the mysterious smoke effect off, hiding the tile from the player. The tile can remain hidden until triggered by player interaction or another game event.
